content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>  <reference anchor='RFC2113'>  <front> <title abbrev='Router Alert Option'>IP Router Alert Option</title> <author initials='D.' surname='Katz' fullname='Dave Katz'> <organization>cisco Systems</organization> <address> <postal> <street>170 W. Tasman Dr.</street> <street>San Jose</street> <street>CA  95134-1706</street> <country>USA</country></postal> <phone>+1 408 526 8284</phone> <email>dkatz@cisco.com</email></address></author> <date year='1997' month='February' /> <area>Routing</area> <keyword>alert</keyword> <keyword>router</keyword> <keyword>routing</keyword> <abstract> <t>    This memo describes a new IP Option type that alerts transit routers    to more closely examine the contents of an IP packet.  This is useful    for, but not limited to, new protocols that are addressed to a    destination but require relatively complex processing in routers    along the path. </t></abstract></front>  <seriesInfo name='RFC' value='2113' /> <format type='TXT' octets='7924' target='http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc2113.txt' /> <format type='HTML' octets='22346' target='http://xml.resource.org/public/rfc/html/rfc2113.html' /> <format type='XML' octets='9075' target='http://xml.resource.org/public/rfc/xml/rfc2113.xml' /> </reference>
